gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: example_top

Explanation: This module appears to be a top-level design for a DDR3 memory controller interface. It instantiates and connects a memory controller wrapper (memc3_wrapper_inst) and a testbench top module (memc3_tb_top_inst). The module includes parameters for configuring various aspects of the memory interface, such as clock periods, memory types, and port configurations. It also defines the input/output ports for interfacing with the DDR3 memory and other system components. The design supports multiple read/write ports (up to 6) for memory access and includes signals for calibration, error reporting, and system clock management.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Based on the given Verilog code for the example_top module, here are the input and output ports along with explanations:

Input ports:
c3_sys_clk, c3_sys_rst_i

Explanation:
c3_sys_clk: System clock input
c3_sys_rst_i: System reset input (active high)

Output ports:
calib_done, error, mcb3_dram_a, mcb3_dram_ba, mcb3_dram_ras_n, mcb3_dram_cas_n, mcb3_dram_we_n, mcb3_dram_odt, mcb3_dram_reset_n, mcb3_dram_cke, mcb3_dram_dm, mcb3_dram_udm, mcb3_dram_ck, mcb3_dram_ck_n

Explanation:
calib_done: Calibration done signal
error: Error signal
mcb3_dram_*: Various DDR3 memory interface signals (address, bank address, control signals, clock, etc.)

Inout ports:
mcb3_dram_dq, mcb3_dram_udqs, mcb3_dram_udqs_n, mcb3_rzq, mcb3_dram_dqs, mcb3_dram_dqs_n

Explanation:
mcb3_dram_dq: Bidirectional data bus for DDR3 memory
mcb3_dram_*dqs*: Data strobe signals for DDR3 memory
mcb3_rzq: DDR3 memory impedance calibration signal

These ports provide the necessary interfaces for connecting the DDR3 memory controller to the actual DDR3 memory chips and the rest of the system, including clock, reset, data, address, and control signals.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:
c3_sys_clk_p, c3_sys_clk_n, c3_error, c3_calib_done, c3_clk0, c3_rst0, c3_async_rst, c3_sysclk_2x, c3_sysclk_2x_180, c3_pll_ce_0, c3_pll_ce_90, c3_pll_lock, c3_mcb_drp_clk, c3_cmp_error, c3_cmp_data_valid, c3_vio_modify_enable, c3_p0_error_status, c3_p1_error_status, c3_p2_error_status, c3_p3_error_status, c3_p4_error_status, c3_p5_error_status, c3_vio_data_mode_value, c3_vio_addr_mode_value, c3_cmp_data, c3_p0_cmd_en, c3_p0_cmd_instr, c3_p0_cmd_bl, c3_p0_cmd_byte_addr, c3_p0_cmd_empty, c3_p0_cmd_full, c3_p0_wr_en, c3_p0_wr_mask, c3_p0_wr_data, c3_p0_wr_full, c3_p0_wr_empty, c3_p0_wr_count, c3_p0_wr_underrun, c3_p0_wr_error, c3_p0_rd_en, c3_p0_rd_data, c3_p0_rd_full, c3_p0_rd_empty, c3_p0_rd_count, c3_p0_rd_overflow, c3_p0_rd_error, c3_selfrefresh_mode.

Explanation:
c3_sys_clk_p, c3_sys_clk_n: Differential system clock signals
c3_error: Error signal from memory controller
c3_calib_done: Calibration done signal
c3_clk0, c3_rst0: Main clock and reset signals
c3_async_rst: Asynchronous reset signal
c3_sysclk_2x, c3_sysclk_2x_180: 2x system clock and its 180-degree phase-shifted version
c3_pll_ce_0, c3_pll_ce_90: PLL clock enable signals (0 and 90 degrees)
c3_pll_lock: PLL lock signal
c3_mcb_drp_clk: Memory controller DRP clock
c3_cmp_error, c3_cmp_data_valid: Comparison error and data valid signals
c3_vio_modify_enable: VIO modification enable signal
c3_p0_error_status to c3_p5_error_status: Error status signals for ports 0-5
c3_vio_data_mode_value, c3_vio_addr_mode_value: VIO data and address mode values
c3_cmp_data: Comparison data
c3_p0_cmd_en to c3_p0_rd_error: Various control and status signals for port 0 (command, write, read)
c3_selfrefresh_mode: Self-refresh mode signal for the memory controller

These internal signals are used for clock management, error handling, data transfer, and control of the memory controller and its various ports.
